paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician upon Sheminith, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician upon Sheminith, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: Help, LORD; for the godly man ceaseth; for the faithful fail from among the children of men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Help, Lord; for the godly man ceaseth; for the faithful fail from among the children of men.

paragraphs.content: They speak vanity every one with his neighbour: with flattering lips and with a double heart do they speak.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They speak vanity every one with his neighbour: with flattering lips and with a double heart do they speak.

paragraphs.content: The LORD shall cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things:
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord shall cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things:

paragraphs.content: Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail; our lips are our own: who is lord over us?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail; our lips are our own: who is lord over us?

paragraphs.content: For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the LORD; I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the Lord; I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.

paragraphs.content: The words of the LORD are pure words: as silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The words of the Lord are pure words: as silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times.

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt keep them, O LORD, thou shalt preserve them from this generation for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt keep them, O Lord, thou shalt preserve them from this generation for ever.

paragraphs.content: The wicked walk on every side, when the vilest men are exalted.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The wicked walk on every side, when the vilest men are exalted.
